A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. The LORD<S>3068</S> is my shepherd<S>7462</S>; I shall not want<S>2637</S>.
He maketh me to lie down<S>7257</S> in green<S>1877</S> pastures<S>4999</S>: he leadeth<S>5095</S> me beside the still<S>4496</S> waters<S>4325</S>. <sup>green: Heb. pastures of tender grass</sup> <sup>still: Heb. waters of quietness</sup>
He restoreth<S>7725</S> my soul<S>5315</S>: he leadeth<S>5148</S> me in the paths<S>4570</S> of righteousness<S>6664</S> for his name's<S>8034</S> sake.
Yea, though I walk<S>3212</S> through the valley<S>1516</S> of the shadow of death<S>6757</S>, I will fear<S>3372</S> no evil<S>7451</S>: for thou art with me; thy rod<S>7626</S> and thy staff<S>4938</S> they comfort<S>5162</S> me.
Thou preparest<S>6186</S> a table<S>7979</S> before<S>6440</S> me in the presence of mine enemies<S>6887</S>: thou anointest<S>1878</S> my head<S>7218</S> with oil<S>8081</S>; my cup<S>3563</S> runneth over<S>7310</S>. <sup>anointest: Heb. makest fat</sup>
Surely goodness<S>2896</S> and mercy<S>2617</S> shall follow<S>7291</S> me all the days<S>3117</S> of my life<S>2416</S>: and I will dwell<S>3427</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> for ever<S>753</S> <S>3117</S>. <sup>for ever: Heb. to length of days</sup>
